entries.title: The Trump administration approved $15.7 billion of proposed arms sales to Saudi Arabia and Israel, according to the Pentagon
The Justice Department released what it says is its final trove of files related to the late Jeffrey Epstein. Here are some takeaways on what we know so far.
The Senate passed a bipartisan deal Friday to fully fund most of the federal government, but congressional action came too late to head off a partial government shutdown that started Saturday morning
Q&A: How does a partial government shutdown work?
Shifting views on the president’s immigration agenda threaten to turn one of his signature issues into a liability for Republicans in the coming midterm elections
Trump’s fed pick came down to the “two Kevins,” but Wall Street lobbying helped Warsh seal the deal.
New York Gov. Kathy Hochul has proposed new legislation prohibiting law enforcement from being deputized by ICE for federal civil immigration operations
Sen. Warren Seeks Warsh’s Position on Criminal Probes of Powell, Cook, Letter Says
Trump is suing the Internal Revenue Service and Treasury Department for $10 billion, alleging they didn’t do enough to prevent an IRS contractor from leaking his tax returns to the press in 2019
Feeling dizzy? You might have a case of “Washington Whiplash.” Read more in today’s WSJ Politics Newsletter:

President Trump and Senate Democrats said there is a deal to avert a partial government shutdown and temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security, as negotiations on proposed restrictions to immigration enforcement will continue
Tulsi Gabbard has been investigating results of the 2020 election that President Trump lost, and earlier this week joined the FBI search of an election center in Georgia
Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota announced she will run for state governor after Gov. Tim Walz said earlier this month that he would not seek a third term
Some young voters are starting to regret their vote for President Trump: A WSJ Poll finds 58% of voters under 30 disapprove of the job he is doing as president
FBI agents searched an election office in Fulton County, Ga., a site that was a focus of President Trump in his effort to overturn his 2020 presidential loss
Elon Musk is opening his wallet and reigniting his political apparatus for the 2026 midterm elections, signaling a return to the political arena
Trump is fast approaching a decision on whether to agree to a Russian proposal to extend limits on long-range nuclear weapons for another year or do nothing when the treaty expires
Lockheed Martin to Quadruple Thaad Missile-Defense Output
The Army will gain access to Salesforce’s technology under a $5.6 billion contract, as the military tries to speed up outdated practices
The Pentagon struck a conciliatory tone toward Beijing in its new defense strategy, stating that its overarching goal is to establish “strategic stability” in the Indo-Pacific region
The Trump administration forced out two Commerce Department officials charged with protecting the U.S. from Chinese tech threats
